message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper deals with the problem of morphologically rich languages in Statistical Machine Translation (SMT), which is a subfield of Natural Language Processing (NLP). Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a solution based on enriching the input with various morphological forms of words, which involves generating unseen morphological forms and injecting them into the original training corpus. This solution involves machine learning techniques and can be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of Factored translation models, which is a type of feature engineering, and can be categorized under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also deals with the problem of data sparsity, which is a common problem in NLP, and can be categorized under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the paper proposes a solution to improve the quality of translation, which involves optimizing the translation model, and can be categorized under cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
